comment._content:
Agree with you about the two on the right (the chap in the bowler is a definite). 
The two on the left look very affectionate to modern eyes. Intrigued to know their story.

comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Yes Woesinger, that is the kind of look that could be a son to his father or just about anything else????/ Nice photo NLI.  The chap on the extreme right looks very Mediteranean/Eastern European. Those two are almost certainly the pair in the 1914 shot and the foreign looker seems to have his father sitting in front of him!

comment.author: 11224990@N02
comment._content: Ok, now that [http://www.flickr.com/photos/woesinger] and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] have commented on the two on the left, I have to ask...  is that a whip?  Why do their canes seem so short?

comment.author: 10706647@N02
comment._content: gentleman second from the left is definitely carrying a whip, and I think I can just about see a cord on the 'whip' of the gentleman sitting down.  I recently had reason to look up the ideal height of a cane and you'd be surprised how short they are supposed to be.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/wiblick] Well, what was the ideal height?? I know people used to be shorter 100 years ago, but they definitely look very titchy altogether...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 10706647@N02
comment._content: letting your arm hang loose the top of the handle should be at your wrist. wupensticks.com/index14.html

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Both the man with the whip standing up and the man on the extreme right are wearing jodphurs or riding breeches, so the whip which might seem incongruous today are probably appropriate.  The gent on the left sitting down also appears to have a whip, he would never lean on that slim handle?

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: There are several group photos at the Imperial ordered by Mr. Corbella. The only person in all of them is 2nd from our right, standing with a cane and bowler hat. Could that be Luigi himself?
